page.content: {EMPLOYMENT MOST OF THE{HONILEY}VILLAGERS ARE SELF- EMPLOYED DOING ODD JOBS, FOR EXAMPLE, HARVESTING, PLUMBING, PAINTING ETC.OTHERS ARE EMPLOYED AT HONILEY HALL, THE LOCAL PIG FARM AND WROXALL ABBEY, A SCHOOL FOR GIRLS. {HONILEY HALL BUILDING ON THE PRESENT HALL WAS BEGUN IN 1914 BY MR.H.L.WADE AND WAS INTENDED AS A FAMILY HOME. DUE TO RISING COSTS THE FAMILY SOLD IT IN {1963 TO WARWICKSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL {WHO USE IT AS A RESIDENTIAL YOUTH {CENTRE.}SOME SLIGHT ALTERATIONS HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE HALL AND ONE NOTICABLE FEATURE OUTSIDE IS THAT DUTCH ELM DISEASE KILLED THE TREES LINING THE DRIVE AND THEY HAD TO BE CUT DOWN. COTTAGES, ONCE PART OF THE ORIGINAL ESTATE ARE NOW OCCUPIED BY THE MEMBERS OF THE WADE FAMILY.
